    • Method Detail

      • addHardConstraint

        public void addHardConstraint(ArrayList<Literal> axioms)
                       throws SolveException
        Adds binary restriction in which every variable has to be true. It builds restrictions like (1-x1) + (1-x2) + x3 + x4 + x5 <= 1 Thus, x1 and x2 must be negative in the ilp while x3,x4 and x5 must be positive (+0) in the ilp. If we have just one axiom in the list, the evidence is directly encoded by restricting the variable to - lb = 0 and ub = 0 (negated) or - lb = 1 and ub = 1 (positive).
        Parameters:
        axioms - Array of components (including name and positive and negated information)
        Throws:
        ParseException - When adding a restriction, there has to be as many variable names as entries in the hasToBePositive Array.
        SolveException

      • addSingleSoftConstraint

        public void addSingleSoftConstraint(double weight,
                           ArrayList<Literal> restriction,
                           boolean conjunction)
                             throws SolveException
        Adds binary restrictions for soft constraints.
        Parameters:
        weight - value of the target function weight of the soft formular
        variableNames - names of the variables
        mustBePositive - Array with values if the respective variable (same position in array) has to be positive or negative
        conjunction - if true, the whole formula is added as conjunction, if false it is added as disjunction.
        dublicateDetection - this string detects if a similar formula has already been added. If no, the formula is added. If yes, the weight of the formula is increased (but no new z variable is generated).
        Throws:
        ParseException - When adding a restriction, there has to be as many variable names as entries in the hasToBePositive Array.
        SolveException

      • returnTrueGroundings

        public ArrayList<String> returnTrueGroundings(HashMap<String,Integer> input)
        Transforms a given list of integer values so that it only returns (1) those where the integer solution is 1 and (2) those which are no added 'z' variables.
        Parameters:

      • close

        public abstract void close()
                    throws ILPException
        Returns all the variables available in the current ILP including the "zzz" variables. The double value contains the actual weight of the variable in the target function.
        Throws:
        ILPException

      • initialize

        public abstract void initialize()
                         throws ILPException
        Throws:

      • addVariable

        public abstract void addVariable(String varName,
               double objWeight,
               double lowerBound,
               double upperBound,
               boolean override,
               boolean isZVar)
                          throws ILPException
        Adds boolean or integer variable. If upperBound is 1 or lower, then the variable is boolean. If upperBound is larger than 1, the variable is integer.
        Parameters:
        varName -
        weight - weight in objective
        upperBound - upper bound of the variable (if > 1 then integer variable)
        override - if true, then the set values are overridden in case the variable already exists.
        isZVar - the connectors can handle zVars different from usual vars
        Throws:
        ILPException

      • addConstraint

        public abstract void addConstraint(ArrayList<ILPVariable> lhs,
                 ILPOperator operator,
                 double rhs)
                            throws ILPException
        Add ILP constraint. All containing variables have been previously added with the 'addVariable()' function.
        Parameters:
        lhs -
        operator -
        rhs -
        Throws:
        ILPException

        public abstract HashMap<String,Integer> optimizeILP()
                                             throws ILPException
        Solves the ILP and returns the integer values for each solution.
        Returns:
        solution.
        Throws:
        ILPException - thrown if infeasible.
